questions.question: Find the eigenvalues of the matrix \(\begin{pmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 2 & 3 \end{pmatrix}\).
Determine if the matrix \(\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{pmatrix}\) is invertible.
Calculate the determinant of the matrix \(\begin{pmatrix} 2 & 3 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 & 4 \\ 5 & 2 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\).
Find the rank of the matrix \(\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{pmatrix}\).
Solve the system of linear equations: \(\begin{cases} 2x + 3y - z = 1 \\ x - y + 4z = 2 \\ 3x + y + 2z = 3 \end{cases}\).
If \(A\) is a 3x3 matrix with eigenvalues 1, 2, and 3, find \(\det(A^{-1})\).
Determine the eigenvalues of the matrix \(\begin{pmatrix} 0 & -1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}\).
Find the inverse of the matrix \(\begin{pmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ 5 & 3 \end{pmatrix}\).
